Key Match Events: Kawhi Leonard made his season debut for the Los Angeles Clippers in Saturday night's 131-105 victory over the Atlanta Hawks at the Intuit Dome.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Tyronn Lue confirmed that the team will be intentional with Leonard's playing time in the coming days.
Lue did not want to commit publicly to an exact number of minutes for Leonard's minutes restriction.
Post-Match Reflections: Leonard gained confidence from the way his return went but knows he's still 'day-to-day' when it comes to his availability due to ongoing right knee soreness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers are currently the No. 7 seed in the Western Conference.
Others: Leonard scored 12 points and collected three rebounds in 19 minutes of play.
He brought the crowd to its feet during the first half after going 3-for-3 from long range.
He finished 3-for-5 from 3, but 4-for-11 from the field overall.
